subject: Parenting
title: Yelling and the Brain
description: A 60-second lesson on Yelling and the Brain.

hook.text: You yell at your child. She freezes. You think she's listening. She's actually in fight-or-flight.

climax.text: A firm, calm voice is heard by the thinking brain. A screaming voice is heard only by the fear brain.

punchline.text: The louder you get, the less they hear.

quiz.question: What happens to a child's brain when they are yelled at?
